Review.Titre: Buyer bewareThis company is a rip-off!!
Review.Contenu: This company is a rip-off. They sent me the wrong part and now they are saying that they won't change it or refund my money because the part is now considered used. I have not even taken the plastic off the part, because I could see that the connecting strip is not the right size,. They tell you that the part will fit your appliance and then blame you if it doesn't and will not take a return or give you your money back.

Review.Titre: False advertisement and won’t own up to it
Review.Contenu: I purchased a part for over $90 that was said to be compatible with my washer. It was not. But because they say it’s compatible they won’t pay for the return. They say I just don’t want the part anymore. What I want is something compatible with my washer that will fix my washer. Since they won’t classify it was a “wrong part” they want me to pay a bunch of money to ship it, pay for shipping insurance (because they make it clear that if it’s damaged in transit I’ll lose all my money), and pay for tracking. So not only did I pay over $90 for a part that will never work, but I’m out money because I have to ship it back. I bet this company is good when the part they send you works, but if it doesn’t they will screw you over.

Review.Titre: The part I ordered was suppose to be…
Review.Contenu: I ordered two grease filters for my LG microwave/vent hood. The grease filters inserts into the vent hood long end first. The OEM grease filter that came with the microwave/vent hood has the metal loop on the long end which I use to position the filter into place. The grease filters I received has the metal loop on the short end. As the long end goes in first, I have to use my fingernails to position the grease filter because pushing on the loop on the short end results in the filter going in unevenly due to the pressure being on one side. As Genuine Replacement Parts states this is LG's new design, I think LG dropped the ball when they "redesigned" this filter and put the loop on the short end.

Review.Titre: Part did not match part number
Review.Contenu: Ordered a part (DW sump) using the model number of the dishwasher; GRP site matched it with the part. I verified that the part number was what I needed. The part that shipped was not the correct part (it was in a bag with the correct part number; but the wrong part inside). The part did not include an opening for the sump sensor. GRP Customer Service wanted pictures, which I sent. I also sent a second round of pictures showing the part that needed replaced and the part they sent, showing the difference in the two parts. They replied that the part they sent was correct for the model I had, and that I should install it. Doing so would mean leaving the sensor hanging outside of the sump. Bad advise since this would cause the wash cycle to fail. I knew enough to ignore this advise and ordered the part from my regular vendor, (exact the same part number that I originally ordered from GRP) and got the part I needed. This was my first order with GRP. Still waiting to see if I will be refunded my $$$. Or if they will want to charge restock/ return postage. I’m chalking this up as a lesson learned. I’ll stick with my current vendor even though they are a few bucks more, I never had an issue getting or returning products.Oh, delivery was quick. The only plus so far, so they got a 2.

As many others here have stated, you should absolutely not order from this company if there's any likelihood that you will need to return the item. If you are certain that you need the part and won't return it, then it will arrive quickly and reasonably priced. They can justify this business model because of their stingy return model. Here's my experience: I ordered a heating element for a dishwasher and then before opening the package realized that something else was causing the problem. So, I didn't even open the shipping box the part arrived in. My original order total was $56.41 and I believe I paid about $9 to have it shipped here with the part costing around $47. Returning the heating element UPS Ground (the method they used to send it to me) cost me $27.89. So, even if they credit me the original purchase price back which is NOT guaranteed in their policy, returning the part will net me $19.11 for a $47 part that I never even removed from the box.It is deeply frustrating to me that it has cost me 3 times the original shipping amount to ship this back. I think it is reasonable for me to pay for the return shipping as long as the cost doesn’t exceed what I initially paid to ship the item. Having a consumer shoulder the cost of shipping is exploitative since shipping companies charge individual consumers much higher than businesses. If GRP provided a return shipping label and then deducted the shipping cost from my return that would make a lot more sense. As it stands, this transfers all of the risk to the consumer.I reached out to the company to give them a chance to respond before posting this review and I was told that shipping was my problem and their shipping rates were low as a "courtesy" to the customer. It's obvious that this is an intentional business model, not a courtesy--and one that is incredibly profitable for them. This return policy is the reason that they can charge what they do for parts and get them to you so quickly. But they've just lost my business. I would encourage you to carefully consider the many similar experiences to mine before purchasing from them.UPDATE (11/18/22): I just received my refund. After "restocking fee," my actual net is $16, which doesn't even cover my time invested in the extensive return process. This is an unacceptable way to do business and I think consumers should be aware before purchasing from Genuine Replacement Parts.

Review.Titre: Website is buggy & still charge you even if order does not go through
Review.Contenu: There is a bug on their website that does not allow customers to correctly change the billing address where the billing address is different from the shipping address. I tried this twice and got the same error.However, they still charged my card two times - even though there was no corresponding order(s) created.Customer service is ok (hence the 2 stars) and advised me the charges will drop off after 3-5 business days.I ended up having to place an order with Sears Parts Direct which was shipped and I received in 2 days. I sympathize with GRP on returns of opened parts and the process to issue the refund but when unopened parts are sent back waiting 15 business days (and I had to call to move it along) + 3-5 business days for refund is unacceptable.  I have a feeling they wait for a call to continue the process possibly hoping some customers will forget.Another issue cropped up.  I notice the refund amount pending for these 2 items are less that what I paid for them + tax.  Immediately I assumed restocking fee, so I perused the webpage to find that policy.  The link I was using (Customer support -> FAQ -> return policy) to the return policy does not mention a restocking fee of any kind and I showed customer support and she agreed with me.  The other link (bottom of home page -> near right of screen -> return policy) shows a completely different policy (which includes mention of restocking fee).Update:  I appreciate the fact you understand my confusion on the restocking fee regarding the old link.  I hope you can understand my frustration of the return process when returning unopened items, it should be much faster.  I do appreciate you actually respond to customer issues as well.

Review.Titre: Replacement baskets for my LG refrigerator door.
Review.Contenu: The items I ordered were not what I needed.  Sadly, the site didn't provide dimensions, which would have helped with ordering.   I had to return the items at my expensive, which cost almost half of the cost of the items.  Plus a $10 restocking fee.  Whatever you do, if you plan on returning the item "DON'T WRITE ON THE BOX."!  I'm giving 5 star, because it was my fault for ordering something I couldn't confirm were the correct items and the service representatives were polite!

Review.Titre: Flawless sale and crazy fast service
Review.Contenu: After ordering my part, I found another part elsewhere for less, but I decided to proceed with my purchase anyway. The next day, I was surprised that my item was on my doorstep in less than 24 hours. Who knows how long it would have taken if I decided to save a few bucks? It was worthwhile, as nobody wants to wait and be without a major appliance for long. Long story short. I was able to repair my dishwasher within ten minutes, and it's running like a champ.

Good web site; provides a complete list of appliance models for which a particular part is appropriate. Pictures of part with dimensions is a plus. Excellent turnaround time from order to receipt of part.

Review.Titre: I have been overwhelming pleased with…
Review.Contenu: I have been overwhelming pleased with the service I have received. I ordered a new mother board from Genuine Replacement Parts for a Whirlpool refrigerator. GRP was quick to ship the part. Upon receiving the part it appeared I had ordered the wrong one. I emailed their customer support. In less than 24 hours I received an email back from Angie. Angie was very polite. Offering to replace the part with the correct one or take a full refund on a $150 part with no questions asked. I emailed Angie more detailed pictures of my fridge info (model/serial number, part number picture of my circuit board) as well as pictures of the part I received. Angie promptly passed the info to GRP’s technicians. With in a few hours she emailed me back with answers to my questions including a written instruction sheet with pictures and a video on how to install the circuit board I received. I had received the correct one it just needed to be broken in half on the seam of the two circuit board.  Their circuit board fit perfectly, fixed my refrigerator, was extremely easy to install and program with the instructions provided by Angie. I would highly recommend GRP. Their customer service is superb and their parts are high quality. Not to to mention how amazing Angie was to answer all my questions promptly, professionally and with such politeness I never once felt I would be stuck with a $150 part because of ordering error on my part. Thank you GRP and huge thank you to Angie for helping me along the way.Eric

I ordered a replacement circulation pump for my Bosch dishwasher. I was able to find the part easily on their site and it was priced competitively. GRP shipped quickly which was great. Unfortunately, the part was damaged upon receipt. It was packed well and no damage to boxes (double boxed). I contacted GRP via their support email with pics of damage and other info they require. They responded quickly, asked for some additional information and before night was over I was told that a replacement would be sent. I received that replacement within two days. Replacement part was in perfect condition and I was able to install and get that project out of the way.I will definitely use GRP in the future.  Their prices were competitive, shipping was quick and their customer service was exceptional! Everything you want  in a company. This is the model to keep customers coming back.  Thank you GRP for a good experience.
